remarks: Write a group sum over a two-dimensional region as a double sum.  (Note that ` C ( j ) ` is a function of ` j ` .)  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 28-Dec-2014.)
statement:
gsum2d2.b $e |- B = ( Base ` G ) $.
gsum2d2.z $e |- .0. = ( 0g ` G ) $.
gsum2d2.g $e |- ( ph -> G e. CMnd ) $.
gsum2d2.a $e |- ( ph -> A e. V ) $.
gsum2d2.r $e |- ( ( ph /\ j e. A ) -> C e. W ) $.
gsum2d2.f $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( j e. A /\ k e. C ) ) -> X e. B ) $.
gsum2d2.u $e |- ( ph -> U e. Fin ) $.
gsum2d2.n $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( ( j e. A /\ k e. C ) /\ -. j U k ) ) -> X = .0. ) $.
gsum2d2 $p |- ( ph -> ( G gsum ( j e. A , k e. C |-> X ) ) = ( G gsum ( j e. A |-> ( G gsum ( k e. C |-> X ) ) ) ) ) $.
$d .0. j k $.
$d A j k $.
$d B j k $.
$d C k $.
$d G j k $.
$d U j k $.
$d V j $.
$d j k ph $.
